title: Taric's stun duration should be longer on closer enemies
body:
Taric's stun has always had that awkwardly useless part where the damage increases insignificantly based on the distance it travels. I've never been sure why; seeing as Taric is supposed to be a tanky, in-your-face kind of support, as shown by his two AoE spells and on-hit passive, it seems counter-intuitive to reward him for "landing" a targeted stun from a long distance, especially when the reward is so small that I don't think anyone's ever actually accounted for it when they're playing.

Since Taric is supposed to be a close range support, I think his stun should have increased duration when it travels short distances. This allows Taric's stun to have a little more strength for following up on cc'd targets and peeling without giving it too much power for making picks and brawling in lane. This also allows for a little more counterplay, since carrying the stun out once you're targeted with a dash/blink will not only move you to safety, but decrease the duration.

Taric needs a rework, plain and simple. He doesn't have the mobility to be an in-your face guy and his stun hardly lasts long enough to walk to the opponent when you get it.
I main Taric supp top or jungle and this would be too op. Believe me. Even without 40% CDR it would pretty much keep someone permastunned.

Because Taric is incentivized to throw down his skills in a Ryze-like rhythm to decrease all of his cooldowns (even his ult!), a buff to his stun duration is the last thing he needs. It would simply make him too powerful to combat. Mind you, he already has incredible bursting power and functions as an anti-assassin tank (On even footing, Taric can out damage Master Yi). His strength is having a small, yet deadly range of power in a fashion not so different from brawlers like Trundle, Darius, or Garen. Unlike any of them, however, he doesn't have a grab (Darius), a speed boost (Garen), or some even ground between the two (Trundle). The only thing he has to close the gap is his stun, which only gives him enough time, even at max level, to run in, maybe get shatter off, and that's it. A smart player is not going to stick around long to allow Taric to burst them into oblivion.

So what should Taric's dazzle be replaced with? I don't know. It wouldn't make much sense for him to be leaping around the Rift like Braum, and his short range of bursting power would make any kind of speed boost too overpowered for him and fit poorly with his gems theme (besides, that's what Righteous Glory is for). One idea I had was to give him an obstacle/slow ability like Trundle's Ice Pillar, obstructing the enemy's movement and allowing him to close the gap while also giving the target a chance to either continue escaping or dig their heels in and stand their ground.

It's a point and click stun, it's already powerful enough and should be the last thing you'd want to buff on Taric. I'd just wait for his eventual rework at this point and see what they'll do with him overall.

Or maybe you meant that it would last shorter than it currently does on targets that are further away from you? Pointless change overall I feel.
